faultdescription: Below is a randomly generated ciphertext(*), each block representing 128 bits. Click on any portion to introduce errors. Below, you can see how the error propagates through decryption with different block cipher modes.
faultdetails: (*) In the background, the same cleartext is encrypted and decrypted with each mode, the visible ciphertext is created using AES128-CBC and acts as a stand-in. Clicking a hex number will always flip the last bit of the 4 bits it represents in each ciphertext.
